posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.66 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Not much special to call out here, but please feel free to keep testing and providing feedback on Polls, Backups, and large screen UI changes.

Complete list of new commits since 7.65.6:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.65.4…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.65 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.66.0 (162000)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

29 new commits since 7.65.4:

Show commits

  • Add new focused state for the local calling pip. [1]

  • Centralize recipient lookup in RecipientRepository. [2]

  • Add ability to force RTL to compose previews. [3]

  • Improve backup progress compose previews. [4]

  • Ensure that restore status gets reset on failure. [5]

  • Add blurring for focused state for local call pip. [6]

  • Fix unread count getting double incremented on new message. [7]

  • Fix websocket reconnect race due to async IMO termination. [8]

  • Fix payment activation messages being sent to wrong threads. [9]

  • Fix issue where bottom bar padding would only appear on second entry. [10]

  • Fix back handling after a one-time donation is completed. [11]

  • Prevent errant click-through to settings button when search is open. [12]

  • Fix on-back-pressed issue after navigating to search result. [13]

  • Respect incognito keyboard setting in Compose UIs. [14]

  • Rewrite layout for call participants to match new spec. [15]

  • Exclude BackupMediaSnapshotTable from legacy local backups. [16]

  • Add split pane UI for add group members screen. [17]

  • Enable split pane UI for add group members screen. [18]

  • Improve some backup strings. [19]

  • Disable user input for tooltips to prevent long press from re-displaying tooltip. [20]

  • Add backup support for theme and bar size settings. [21]

  • Fix potential performance issues during backup attachment upload. [22]

  • Write voice recording data in 1s intervals to drafts. [23]

  • Add 2s timeout to message notifier icon loading. [24]

  • Fix various issues with optimized media. [25]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.86.4 [26]

  • Redownload emoji search index if data is missing. [27]

  • Update translations and other static files. [28]

  • Bump version to 7.66.0 [29]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.65.4…v7.66.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

At least 67 languages changed since 7.65.4:

For technical reasons, not all languages may be listed below. However, everything from “Updated language translations” and similar commits is listed, so the list is likely complete. You can view the full comparison to 7.65.4 so far here.

cody-signal:

please feel free to keep testing and providing feedback on Polls

posts.cooked:
In the Poll details the star icon that indicates which option is in the lead appears a bit too close to the text. Just adding a few pixels here would make it look a lot cleaner.

Screenshot:

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: The issue with search is fixed, thanks

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.65 release Android Beta Feedback
For me too. It also happens when scrolling up in this chat for older “donate” buttons and when trying to donate via the “donate for others” announcement post from 2022. All on stable v7.65.3 as well.

Looks like this was fixed in v7.65.4 stable, no longer crashes when pressing Donate, thanks!

I think pressing Donate should show the first Donation landing page where Donate for a Friend is visible. This might encourage more people to donate for a friend so they can gift the UFO badge for 60 days, which is the best value option.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.65 release

posts.cooked:
shaded:

In the Poll

I noticed on WhatsApp that polls allow up to 12 options, while Signal has a limit of 10 options.

On WhatsApp it also shows a warning if you have duplicate entries! Signal doesn’t show this.

And WhatsApp asks for confirmation before backing out of a poll, so it doesn’t get wiped. Signal doesn’t show any warning and adding a poll again starts from scratch, so the question and options are lost

Edit: it’s not possible to add text formatting to the question and options in Signal polls. Might be cool to allow bold, italic, strikethrough, monospace and spoiler text formatting in polls

I just got access to polls and I have one bit of feedback. The toggle labeled “allow multiple votes” should be relabeled as “allow multiple selections”. Multiple votes sounds like the same person can vote more than once.

Screenshot_20251120-064922~21008×2138 66.5 KB

Akikou:

The toggle labeled “allow multiple votes”

On WhatsApp it’s labelled “Allow multiple answers” and it’s enabled by default! Nice that Signal has it disabled by default.

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked: Thanks for the feedback and reports, we’re processing them.

New Version: 7.66.1 (162100)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

5 new commits since 7.66.0:

  • Hide local user badge everywhere unless they have it enabled. [1]

  • Fix backup restore after captcha navigation bug. [2]

  • Make restore dialogs not cancelable. [3]

  • Update translations and other static files. [4]

  • Bump version to 7.66.1 [5]

posts.cooked:
I was on a call, using loudspeaker, and checking my story as it expired after 24 hours, which I think caused the call to get disconnected

I guess to replicate this bug, you’d have to post a story, then voice call someone after 23 hours, 59 minutes and open info for the story, to watch it expire, and the call should disconnect unexpectedly!

Debug Log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.65.4/f5b159e0cf533223c74868bee88bd4ba2ec87afe647f9c803ce182135af2a592 (stable)

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
I’m still facing this issue on 7.66 already reported by rassilon1963 on 7.63:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.63 release Android Beta Feedback
this very weird thing happened when trying to react to a message. [Screenshot_20251031-085502_Signal] clicking the back button in this state brought me to the chat list, with the message buttons still there. [Screenshot_20251031-085536_Signal] https://debuglogs.org/android/7.63.0/3b880d9d69cfd08bc08197402a71ecf20520f9ebf5d4d12e63427759fa065779 edit: turns out this happens consistently with every long press, even after force stopping the app. another thing that may not be super obvious du…

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.63 release

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
Aku-Stable:

I was on a call, using loudspeaker, and checking my story as it expired after 24 hours, which I think caused the call to get disconnected

The app actually crashed and that’s what killed the call. Tracking.

Xashyar:

I’m still facing this issue on 7.66 already reported by rassilon1963 on 7.63:

Re-raised it with the team.

cody-signal:

The app actually crashed and that’s what killed the call. Tracking.

Thanks for looking into it, hope you have a good weekend

Edit: hope everyone reading this has a good weekend and week ahead

  • Bump version to 7.66.2 [4]

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked: When creating a poll, tapping the toggle itself for “Allow multiple votes" doesn’t work. What works is tapping the row where it sits, so for example tapping the label “Allow multiple votes" does activate or deactivate the toggle.

posts.name: Golden Dragonfly
posts.cooked: When on a Signal voice/video call, if one person has their video turned on and the other person is only on audio (video off), the person who has video off experiences this issue: after a short time, their phone screen dims and then automatically turns off (screen timeout), even though they are actively in a call.

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
Backing out of a search no longer closes the app - However there’s a new issue now

Search for a chat

Open chat

Back out

You are returned to the search results but they’re not “cached” so you see a blank page for a second while the search results load

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.66.1/5e6558b7e9952a81ab2766ffede49cd135f7c11e07744b2f6251ce45240fd381
